channel.title: Need help using the 'repeat' function
channel.description: Ok i have only been writing scar scripts for a coupe of weeks and every time i put the 'repeat' bit on the end of a of my scripts it never works, it usually says 'identifier expected' i have tried all sorts of things to try and get it working but it never works, please help

item.title: Need help using the 'repeat' function
item.dc:creator: @eggi4792 eggi4792
item.description:
@eggi4792 wrote:

o ye i knew that, this is for one of those random internet sim games

Read full topic

item.title: Need help using the 'repeat' function
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Well, if you want humanlike mouse movements (for runescape) setup SRL, then use Mouse or MMouse.

if you are just making a clicker for some random flash game and you want fast, detectable clicks, use Clickmouse.
They each have their own pro’s and Con’s

Read full topic

item.title: Need help using the 'repeat' function
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

program new;

begin
  repeat
   ClickMouse(291, 274, true);
   Wait(3000)
   ClickMouse(189, 318, true);
   Wait(1000)
  until(false)
end.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help using the 'repeat' function
item.dc:creator: @eggi4792 eggi4792
item.description:
@eggi4792 wrote:

I’m sorry guys, but i still don’t completely understand, could someone make this code repeat for me as an exampe?

[code]program New;

begin
ClickMouse(291, 274, true);
Wait(3000)
ClickMouse(189, 318, true);
Wait(1000)
end.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Need help using the 'repeat' function
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

A larger example of my simple auto drop procedure

Procedure DropIt; begin Dropped:=0; repeat if(FindColorTolerance(x,y,ItemColor,MIX1, MIY1, MIX2,MIY2,ItemTolerance))then begin wait(100) MMouse(x,y,2,2); if(IsUpText(ItemName))then begin GetMousePos(x,y); Mouse(x,y,1,1,false); Wait(200+ random(100)); ChooseOption(x,y,'rop'); Dropped:=Dropped+1; end; end; until not (FindColorTolerance(x,y,ItemColor,MIX1, MIY1, MIX2,MIY2,ItemTolerance)) Writeln('Dropped ' +inttostr(Dropped) +' "'+itemname +'"s. Terminating script.') end;

This is where syntax comes in handy. You see my repeat that is indented 2 spaces? follow that down to my ‘Until’ which is towards the bottom, and indented two spaces.
This continually repeats EVERYTHING between those two commands until it doesn’t find the item color anymore.

Everything must still contain a ‘Begin’ and ‘End;’ (unless you are calling out a procedure which already has its begin and end).

Read full topic

item.title: Need help using the 'repeat' function
item.dc:creator: @existingqwer existingqwer
item.description:
@existingqwer wrote:

[quote=“mjordan, post:4, topic:112960”][quote author=eggi4792 link=topic=161510.msg1513824#msg1513824 date=1182219257]
so the bit in your example where it says mine() would be be my entire script right?
[/quote]
No it is where you would put whatever procedures you want it to do.

I suggest taking a look at someone elses main loop, and you for sure should understand it.[/quote]
It would be whatever part of the script you want to repeat, until something happens. Something being until(something)

Read full topic

blah blah blah

until(condition)

ex:

mine();
until(invneotrycount=15);
